ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? Sitting and Reading
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? Watching TV
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? Sitting, inactive in a public place (e.g. a theatre or a meeting)
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? As a passenger in a car for an hour without a break
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? Sitting and talking to someone
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? Sitting quietly after a lunch without alcohol
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the situations described below, in contrast to feeling just tired? In a car, while stopped for a few minutes in traffic
Notes: 0=Would  never doze; 1 =Slight  change of dozing; 2 =Moderate  chance of dozing; 3 =High chance of dozing

ElementDescription: ESS score
Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Sitting and reading
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep

ElementDescription: Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Sitting and watching TV or a video
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep

ElementDescription: Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Sitting in a classroom at school during the morning
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep

ElementDescription: Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Sitting and riding in a car or bus for about half an hour
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep

ElementDescription: Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Lying down to rest in the afternoon
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep

ElementDescription: Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Sitting and talking to someone
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep

ElementDescription: Over the last month, how likely have you been to fall asleep while doing these things that are described below? Sitting quietly by yourself after lunch
Notes: 0 = Would never fall asleep; 1 = Slight chance of falling asleep; 2 = Moderate chance of falling asleep; 3 = High chance of falling asleep
